TopicTitle: In what do you play when you are bored KSP?

Articles.Content:
KSP is like drug i can play several days in it for several hours(enjoying vacation) , but eventually i get bored, and play some others games, total war series, The Sims 3, some other strategy games, but eventually i have "withdrawal syndrome" that i must conduct another space mission, despite i being bored:D

My question how long did you play KSP before you feel bored, and in which game did you play when you didn't play KSP?

I often play months before going totally mad and i crash my game.

Then i play more passive things like space engineers (i sometimes get mad at that game too!), GTA, Need for speed, etc.

Then i come back and repeat the process.

I like strategy games best. The Civilization series, X-COM, and Alpha Centauri are my favorite turn based ones. The Homeworld series and Harpoon are my favorite realtime ones.

I don't play shooters, RPGs, racing or sports games; if that's your interest I have no advice.

I don't play shooters, RPGs, racing or sports games; if that's your interest I have no advice.

The same like my, but i'm like racing games NFS series in particular, i'm not like RPG games because they are fantasy, and i'm hate fantasy (spells wizard and all that s...., you know what i mean ) But i like Mass Effect series.
Team Fortress 2.
For the majority of my life I've been playing in atmosphere and sometimes in hydrosphere of Earth. I'm dreaming of playing in mud. Sterile mud (not a fan of germs).

I think you're turning into my old forum personality...

I used to go for months playing nothing but KSP. (The number of hours I've played in the last year rivals a part-time job.) But in the last couple of months I've cooled off on it. Now I alternate games every couple of days.

When I'm not wasting my time playing KSP I can be found wasting my time playing Civ IV, Port Royale 3, Banished, the enhanced Baldur's Gates, and maybe one of the incarnations of Settlers.

Tabletop stuff.

Tsuro, Pandemic, Sails of Glory, Dixit, Munchkin, GURPS, etc.

Command: Modern air and Naval Operations

Global Conflict Blue

Creeper World 2 or 3

Anno 2070

Sword of the Stars

League of Legends

Battlefield

FIFA (guilty pleasure)

Portal

Any and all decent racing games/sims

1. Watch GTA V videos

2. Lament its lack of a release date for PC

3. Make a thread about it

4. Cry

5. Repeat

usually I play for a few hours sometimes, then:

1. Wargame: Airland Battle + Red Dragon

2. Rimworld

3. 6.4.0 RSS config KSP

4. Prop Hunt on Gmod

5. TF 2

The fact is that I stopped playing KSP until every mod is 64 bits compatible. I play with a truckload of mods and having crashes bored me. So now I spend my time on DayZ standalone, ArmA III, Insurgency... and I'm hysterically waiting for the new Rust version to be more complete

I mainly spend most of my extra time on World of Warcraft. I'm very fond of the pleasant community in the game. Most of the degenerate players from WoW have fortunately quit and moved to different games like League of Legends, hence the present psychotic community in LoL.

If WoW is unavailable I'll play KSP. If I am tired of KSP I will most likely be surfing in Team Fortress 2's surf servers or playing some other steam game.
